``` #!/usr/bin/env ruby # shuffle_play class Array *Open Classes* =begin rdoc Non-destructive; returns a copy of self, re-ordered randomly. =end ❶ def shuffle() sort_by { rand } *Blocks; The **`sort_by`** Method* end =begin rdoc Destructive; re-orders self randomly. =end ❷ def shuffle!() replace(shuffle) *The **`replace`** Method* end =begin rdoc While we're here, we might as well offer a method for pulling out a random member of the Array. =end ❸ def random_element() shuffle[0] end end # Array ### class ShufflePlayer ❹ def initialize(files) @files = files end =begin rdoc Plays a shuffled version of self with the play_file method. =end ❺ def play() @files.shuffle.each do |file| *The **`each`** Method* play_file(file) end end ❻ private =begin rdoc Uses ogg123, assumes presence and appropriateness. =end def play_file(file) ❼ system("ogg123 #{file}") *The **`system`** Method* end end # ShufflePlayer ### ❽ sp = ShufflePlayer.new(ARGV) sp.play() ```
